content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun clash, and easy to understand the task & rules.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The test is a good exercise for looping and conditional logics

Hello,

Good idea for a clash

in addition to the comments made by 5DN1L, could you review the names of the test peers and validators. There's some confusion here...

Goal
* Please explain the Roman numerals so that players who are not familiar with them do not need to look up the information in other sites during a clash.

Input
* Please format "romantime" as a [[variable]].

* Please change "HH MM" to "[[RH]]{{:}}[[RM]]" and remove the quotation marks.

* 2nd line: Please change "HH" to "[[RH]]" to distinguish it from HH in output.

* 3rd line: Please change "MM" to "[[RM]]" to distinguish it from MM in output.

Output
* Please change "HH MM" to "[[HH]]{{:}}[[MM]]" and remove the quotation marks.

Constraints
* Please delete all the constraints, which are merely repetition of what has been stated in other sections.

* Please add [[romantime]] is always a valid time.

Cases
* Suggest to add a new pair of test and validator where HH = 10 and 16 ≤ MM ≤ 18.

* Suggest to add a new pair of test and validator where HH = 11 and 30 ≤ MM ≤ 39.

Thanks.
Thanks for the input. Please review the changes. Let me know if you find anything else. Thank you once again :-)

You're welcome. Would you please follow up the two points below?

Goal
* Please include the explanation of *relevant* Roman numerals only.

   • C, D and M are irrelevant and should be excluded.

   • 20, 30, 40 and 50 are relevant and should be included.

You may check out this contribution for your reference:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/4166536b18f75726768505ffe399c9a8d7400

Constraints
* Please delete ">>".

Thanks.

It's updated now :-). 
I want to add a link to Google Image where all the Roman numbers from 1-59 will be given for reference. But I am unable to add a clickable link in the statement. Please help me with it.

Thank you.

There is no way to add a clickable link in a clash statement.
